items.title: Biogas sector expected to see ₹5,000 crore investment in 2026-27: IBA
India adds 50GW RE capacity with ₹2 lakh cr investment in 2025; to keep momentum in 2026
items.summary:
- India plans 50 GW of RE by 2025 with ₹2 lakh crore, aiming to sustain momentum into 2026.
- Hitachi Energy's N. Venu calls for stronger transmission, faster renewable-zone development, energy storage, and programme-based rollout.
- If executed well, grid upgrades could boost energy security, reduce costs, and attract more investment.

items.title: Chile regulator approves Codelco-SQM lithium deal hours after announcing audit
items.summary:
- Chile's regulator approved the Codelco-SQM lithium venture in Atacama, but with guidelines amid an unprecedented Comptroller audit.
- The audit proceeds despite prior rulings, aiming for transparency while the deal's structure keeps Codelco above 50%.
- The accord advances Boric's plan for greater state control of lithium, fueling questions about direct negotiations, bidding, and SQM's role.

items.title: PM Modi to unveil ₹10,600-crore fertiliser plant in Assam on Sunday
US Space Development Agency places $3.5 billion order for 72 satellites
Odisha steel output rises 19% as Centre pushes green steel measures
US coffee drinkers face higher prices even after Trump's tariff reset
PM Modi lays foundation for ₹10,600-crore urea plant at Assam’s Namrup
Subansir Lower's 250 MW Unit-2 to begin commercial supply in December: NHPC
Parliamentary panel suggests funding boost for state-owned IREL to prioritise rare earth mining
items.summary:
- Parliamentary panel urges targeted budgetary support to IREL to prioritise exploration and mining of Rare Earth Elements (REEs) to reduce import dependence.
- Recommendations call for domestic availability strategies, tech transfer via international collaborations, and strengthening the IREL value chain with expanded processing capacity.
- GSI is accelerating REE exploration (186 projects in 3 years; 94 ongoing) while IREL runs plants in Chatrapur, Aluva and Kollam to boost output and R&D for a stronger REE sector.

items.title: Titagarh Rail Systems rolls out first driverless trainset for Ahmedabad Metro Phase 2
items.summary:
- Titagarh rolled out the first driverless trainset for Ahmedabad Metro Phase 2 at its Uttarpara facility, using a Train Control and Management System for unattended operation.
- The trainset has 70-75% local content and serves a 28.26 km elevated corridor (Yellow Line 23.8 km and Violet Line branch) with 22 stations.
- CM Bhupendrabhai Patel highlighted Make in India/Atmanirbhar Bharat and indigenous design as Gujarat's metro network expands beyond 1,000 km.

items.title: Eggs safe for consumption, linking them to cancer risk is misleading: FSSAI
Jaya Hind Industries to ramp up production at Tamil Nadu plant
items.summary:
- Ground-breaking to expand near Chennai (Kottaiyur, Thiruvallur) with ₹200 crore investment.
- A 13,000 sq m shed will house HPDC equipment (1,400–4,400 t) for engine and EV components.
- Post-expansion Chennai plant aims for ~20,000 tonnes/year, strengthening die-casting, vertical integration, and client reach.

items.title: India’s manufacturing ambitions trigger scramble for leadership talent
items.summary:
- India's manufacturing hiring surge aims to reduce dependence on the US and China and expand markets amid geopolitical uncertainty.
- Recruitment firms report rising mandates for leaders in engineering-led manufacturing, electronics and semiconductors, R&D, and digital transformation.
- Expat talent, higher salaries, and a push to automate, implement Industry 4.0, and localise supply chains span plant heads to senior roles in EV, batteries, and green tech.

items.title: UP’s first semiconductor unit by HCL–Foxconn to break ground in Jan 2026
items.summary:
- Groundbreaking planned mid-Jan 2026 for UP's first semiconductor unit (HCL–Foxconn) in Jewar; ₹3,706 crore, 20,000 wafers/month.
- Facility will manufacture DDICs and aim to reduce India’s DDIC imports; positions UP as a key node in the semiconductor value chain.
- Project to bring global expertise, boost local skills, and advance India's semiconductor self-reliance.

items.title: Parle Agro profit jumps manifold to ₹115.38 cr in FY25, revenue rises 5% to ₹3,284 cr
items.summary:
- Parle Agro's FY25 revenue from operations rose 5% to ₹3,284.13 crore; total income including other income rose 5% to ₹3,370.14 crore; consolidated net profit stood at ₹115.38 crore vs ₹17.3 crore in FY24.
- Advertising/promotional expenses declined 7.74% to ₹256.83 crore while total expenses rose 0.8% to ₹3,221.39 crore, indicating improved margins.
- Domestic sales reached ₹3,214.27 crore and exports ₹30.07 crore in FY25; FY24 revenue from operations was ₹3,126.06 crore with net profit ₹17.3 crore.

items.title: Bihar to procure 300 MW wind power from Torrent at ₹4.04/kWh
items.summary:
- Bihar will procure 300 MW of wind power from Torrent Green Energy via SECI, at a final tariff of ₹4.04 per kWh after SECI's 7-paise markup.
- The CERC had approved ₹3.97 per kWh for the Gujarat project; Torrent won the 300 MW block in SECI's March 2025 bidding.
- The 300 MW plant will be located in Gujarat and supplied to Bihar over the inter-state transmission system, supporting renewable targets and signaling wind-tariff firming.

items.title: ERG signs a long-term gallium supply deal with Mitsubishi
items.summary:
- ERG signs a long-term gallium supply deal with Mitsubishi Corporation RtM Japan Ltd, targeting about 15 metric tons per year from Kazakhstan’s bauxite-alumina chain.
- Production from 2026 (Q3) could make Kazakhstan the world’s second-largest gallium producer after China.
- Gallium is a critical mineral for semiconductors and defense electronics; China currently dominates supply with licensing under Beijing controls.

items.title: On a building spree: Consumer cos, auto inc push capex pedal
items.summary:
- Capex plans span FMCG (₹5,000 crore+ new capacity) and automakers (₹1.77 lakh crore through 2029–30), signaling a multi-year capex spree.
- GST cuts and stabilising commodity prices are boosting consumer spend; Nestlé's Odisha plant expansion and other players (JHS Svendgaard, DFM Foods) illustrate sector-wide investment.
- Executives expect demand-driven growth via capacity expansion, exports and R&D, with strong upside through the next few years.

items.title: India joins the advanced economies with reassessed 7.97% logistics cost to GDP
items.summary: - DPIIT–NCAER estimates logistics cost at 7.97% of GDP for 2023–24, down from the 13–18% range cited earlier. - Total logistics cost ₹24 lakh crore; roads 41.7%, warehousing 24.8%, material handling 16.1%, waterways 7.6%, rail 6.7%, air 3%; rail is the most economical. - Officials push formal adoption and expect LPI gains and single-digit costs by Dec 2025, signaling a shift toward advanced-economy status.

items.title: NCRTC to set up 110 MW solar plant in UP to power Namo Bharat corridor
items.summary:
- 110 MW solar plant in Uttar Pradesh for the Delhi–Ghaziabad–Meerut Namo Bharat corridor; NCRTC-NLCIL joint venture with NLC India Limited; connected to UP grid.
- Expected to meet ~60% of corridor demand and cut NCRTC electricity expenditure by ~25%; completion targeted in 24 months.
- Estimated CO2 reductions ~1.77 lakh tonnes/year; a scalable model for other urban transport networks aligned with the National Solar Mission.

items.title: ISRO to launch communication satellite of US-based AST SpaceMobile on December 24
items.summary:
- ISRO's LVM3-M6 will launch on 24 December 2025 from SDSC SHAR as a dedicated commercial mission for AST SpaceMobile.
- The BlueBird Block-2 satellite will be launched under NSIL's commercial agreement, enabling 24/7 cellular broadband to smartphones from LEO.
- Equipped with ~2,400 ft² phased-array antennas, it aims to expand global coverage; BlueBirds earlier had ~693 ft².

items.title: China requests WTO consultations with India over ICT tariff, solar subsidies
Waaree Solar Americas to invest $30 million in United Solar to secure polysilicon supply
items.summary:
- Waaree Solar Americas to invest $30 million in United Solar Holding via Series B preferred shares with a long-term polysilicon offtake to secure US supply chains.
- Investment backs United Solar’s Sohar Freezone plant in Oman targeting 100,000 metric tons/year polysilicon and about 40 GW/year solar module fabrication, with production slated for 2026.
- The deal aims to diversify polysilicon sources, boost Waaree’s supply-chain resilience and may enable future wafer/cell integration, jobs for Omani nationals.

items.title: Nexperia's China unit switches to local firms for wafer supplies
Coca-Cola India sees 46.3% profit surge in FY25, revenue Up 7%
items.summary:
- FY25 consolidated profit ₹615.03 crore, up 46.3%, on revenue ₹5,042.56 crore (+7%); total income ₹5,171.48 crore (+7.7%).
- FY24: net profit ₹420.3 crore; revenue from operations ₹4,713.38 crore; expenses rose 2.8% to ₹4,328.37 crore.
- Royalty to US parent rose 9.65%; tax expense up 33%; company controlled via Coca-Cola South Asia (India) Holdings Ltd; HCCB divested 40% stake.

items.title: India's defence shipbuilding sector stands at multi-decade transformation threshold: Report
items.summary:
- Defence shipbuilding in India is at a multi-decade transformation, driven by naval capex, policy stimulus, and Indian Ocean imperatives (₹2.3+ trillion in projects).
- The ₹697 billion Shipbuilding and Maritime Development Package funds finance, guarantees, and eight coastal clusters to boost domestic build and push for a top-five global shipbuilder by 2047.
- Exports reached ₹236 billion in FY25; 75% of defence procurement is domestic, benefiting yards like Mazagon Dock, Cochin Shipyard and Garden Reach and increasing indigenisation.

items.title: Shree Cement to invest ₹2,000 cr in Maharashtra manufacturing unit
items.summary:
- ₹2,000 crore to build a 2 MTPA cement plant in Chandrapur, Maharashtra, as part of a plan to lift capacity from 68 to 80 MTPA; land acquisition near complete, ToR issued, EC awaited; construction ~2 years.
- Funded from internal accruals; cash reserves >₹5,000 crore and no borrowings; CM Devendra Fadnavis attended; Shree Cement already runs a Pune grinding unit.
- Target 100 MTPA by ~2030 after 80 MTPA; Shree Cement is among India's top three cement producers; Raipur plant closure due to worker non-cooperation.

items.title: India-Oman CEPA opens new avenues in trade, mobility, investment: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: - India-Oman CEPA is a major shift to deepen bilateral trade and energise 21st-century engagement, with PM Modi at the signing and signaling a reoriented, complementary-trade policy.\n- Tariff and investment: Oman offers zero duty on 98.08% of lines (covering 99.38% of India's exports); India liberalises 77.79% of lines; 100% FDI in major services via commercial presence; sensitive items protected.\n- Beyond trade, the pact envisages mobility, space, pharma and manufacturing gains, marble value addition, remittances by ~700k Indians (₹18,000 crore), and planned social-security coordination to expand Indian investment into GCC, Africa, and Central Europe.

items.title: Japan's JERA secures government subsidy for US ammonia imports
items.summary:
- JERA will import low-carbon ammonia from a US plant in 2029 with a 15-year government subsidy to cover the coal price gap, via Blue Point (CF Industries 40%, Mitsui 25%, JERA 35%).
- A $4 billion Louisiana facility will produce about 500,000 t/yr for JERA, Hekinan and others, aiming for up to 20% ammonia co-firing with coal at Hekinan No.4 from Apr 2029.
- Government support will cover price gaps for partners including Hokkaido Electric, Mitsubishi UBE Cement and Tosoh, about 280,000 t/yr from Blue Point by FY2030.

items.title: AI-driven data centres to lift demand for gensets in India: Cummins
items.summary:
- Cummins expects India's data-centre boom to lift backup power demand as AI workloads push uptime to 99.99% and boost genset sales.
- Site readiness and approvals remain bottlenecks; Cummins India reported strong Sep 2025 results and is launching an 82.5 kVA genset for warehouses.
- Hydrogen engines exist but progress is slow; a 30–40 year transition with renewables as zero-carbon option, constrained by cost and storage, while exports grow.

Pfizer, Cipla enter exclusive marketing agreement for select medicines in India

FMCG and auto majors ramp up manufacturing capacity amid demand growth and GST gains
Shree Cement declares lockout at Chhattisgarh plant; production hit by 10,000 tonnes a day
Hindustan Construction Company bags ₹901 crore tunnel contract from North Frontier Railway
items.summary:
- HCC wins a ₹901-crore tunnel contract (New Tunnel 28) from Northeast Frontier Railway via the HCC–VCCL JV (HCC 65%).
- Scope includes a 3.5 km main tunnel, design/engineering, ballast-less track, rail systems installation/testing, ventilation and E&M works, and approach roads.
- Completion timeline not disclosed; transport projects ~63% of HCC’s ₹13,152 crore order book as of Nov 2025.

items.title: India–Sweden ties gather momentum as sustainability moves to the centre of cooperation
items.summary:
- Trade between India and Sweden is around $17B and growing; a future free trade agreement could accelerate expansion.
- The partnership emphasizes sustainability, digitalization and manufacturing, with green hydrogen, AI and Industry 4.0 as priorities.
- Team Sweden and cross-sector collaboration drive pilots toward commercial deployment and climate finance.

items.title: Can Andhra’s rare earth corridor fuel India’s clean-energy dreams?
items.summary:
- Andhra Pradesh’s coast hosts high-grade monazite-rich sands (La–Gd) from Srikakulam to Nellore, underpinning a large domestic REE base.
- Policy allocates leases, enables private processing, and builds IREL’s 10,000 tpa monazite plant to shore up downstream magnets and components.
- Pilot recycling from mining waste (fly ash, red mud) and tailings could sharply cut imports and unlock a full REE value chain.

items.title: Google works to erode Nvidia's software advantage with Meta's help
items.summary:
- TorchTPU aims to align TPUs with PyTorch, removing software barriers and potentially using open-source components to speed adoption.
- Google collaborates with Meta to expand TPU access and compete with Nvidia’s CUDA-PyTorch ecosystem, with Google Cloud selling TPUs to data centers.
- Amin Vahdat now leads AI infrastructure to oversee hardware/software strategy, while Gemini and AI-powered search illustrate Google's ROI-driven AI push.

items.title: Republican lawmakers decry Intel's testing of Chinese-linked tools after report
items.summary:
- Intel reportedly evaluated ACM Research equipment for the 14A process; ACM has China ties and was sanctioned; Intel says it is not using ACM tools and follows U.S. laws.
- Republicans warn that Chinese-linked tools could threaten national security and push for restrictions on subsidized chipmakers and deployments.
- ACM's Shanghai unit rose on the report; Reuters found no proof of violations and Intel says data remains isolated with ongoing dialogue with lawmakers.
